intro: Buena skinneri, commonly known as the Skinner's buena, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Buena skinneri is considered a threatened species.
